page.title: 18MINERS HOME
page.content: The Nottinghamshire Miners convalescent Home was opened in 1969.Its 30 metres from the beach.It is not a holiday home.Its a convalescent home for injured and retired miners.It takes 800 patients a season and it has 15 staff.The property is valued at over one million pounds.There are 35 bedrooms and 18 bathrooms.There is a TV room,a sun lounge,and beautiful gardens.Mr and Mrs Gills run it and came from the city of Nottingham.The miners come in coaches and cars.When the Home closes in the winter a Safety School giving lectures for miners takes place.The 1984/5 strike did not affect the numbers of people coming.In winter the Home with its big kitchen sometimes make mince pies for the school Xmas functions.
